snippet: The storm damage sustained by NYU Langone Medical Center in Manhattan, with its combination of clinical, research and academic facilities, could cost up to $1 billion.
abstract: NYU Langone Medical Center, with its combination of clinical, research and academic facilities, may have been the New York City hospital most devastated by Hurricane Sandy; officials estimate that repairs could cost the hospital $700 million to $1 billion, figure that includes not only cleanup and rebuilding but lost revenue from interrupted research projects.
lead_paragraph: The storm damage sustained by NYU Langone Medical Center in Manhattan, with its combination of clinical, research and academic facilities, could cost up to $1 billion.

headline.seo: FEMA Chief Tours Damaged NYU Langone Medical Center
headline.main: A Flooded Mess That Was a Medical Gem
headline.print_headline: A Flooded Mess That Was a Medical Gem
